title: Business Live: Sterling rebounds - BBC News
summary: tesco to cut 1,200 head office jobs .
fca cracks down on fund management fees .

documents.title: good night
text: that 's it for wednesday 's business live .
many thanks for staying with us .
please do join us again tomorrow morning from 6am for all the business news , analysis and reaction .

documents.title: japanese airline forces disabled man to crawl aboard
text: japan 's vanilla air has apologised after a wheelchair user was forced to crawl up a set of stairs to the plane .
hideto kijima had boarded with the help of friends on his outbound flight .
but on the return leg from the island of amami , airline employees told him that for safety reasons , he would not be allowed to board if he could not climb the stairs without assistance .
in response , mr kijima left his wheelchair and pulled himself up the stairs with his arms .
read more here .

documents.title: public sector pay cap under review , no 10 suggests
text: the limit on public sector salary rises could be reviewed , downing street has signalled , as a labour attempt to scrap the 1 % cap was defeated in parliament .
two cabinet ministers have said the five-year cap may be reconsidered while the pm 's spokesman suggested the autumn budget could herald a change of course .
downing street later sought to dampen down the speculation , insisting current government policy had not changed .
and mps rejected a labour motion urging immediate change by a majority of 14 .
read more here .

documents.title: wall street rebounds
text: the s & p 500 finished higher as financial and tech stocks led a broad market rebound .
the benchmark s & p had suffered its biggest one-day drop in about six weeks on tuesday after a healthcare bill was delayed in the u.s. senate .
the dow jones industrial average rose 0.66 % to 21,452.15 , the s & p 500 gained 0.88 % , rising to 2,440.58 , and the nasdaq composite added 1.43 % , moving up to 6,218.56 .

documents.title: paypal invests in online loans startup
text: paypal has invested in lendup , a san francisco-based startup that offers loans online to consumers who have been traditionally overlooked by banks because they are considered too risky .
the firms did not disclose the terms of the deal .

documents.title: man loses £ 1,200 in tech support scam
text: the uk police and microsoft have teamed up to tackle it support scammers who tell victims their computers need to be repaired and then con them out of their savings .
one man told bbc technology correspondent rory cellan-jones how he came to be defrauded .
simon greaves who fell victim to the it support scam tells me how he ended up paying out £ 1200 to fraudsters

documents.title: brexit 'will blow hole in budget ' , eu commissioner warns
text: the uk 's departure from the eu will leave a budget shortfall of at least €10bn ( £ 8.8bn ; $ 11.4bn ) , the budget commissioner has warned .
guenther oettinger said the bloc must either spend less or find new money to fill the gap , equivalent to an estimated 16 % of the entire budget .
among the options on the table could be less generous payments to farmers or a tax on financial transactions .
`` a big country , a net contributor is leaving , '' mr oettinger said .
`` that must have consequences . ''
read more here .

documents.title: eu extends russia sanctions
text: the european union has formally extended economic sanctions against russia for a further six months , saying moscow had failed to live up to its ceasefire commitments , reports bbc world service .
eu leaders approved the move last week , saying russia had not halted its support for rebels in eastern ukraine .
the sanctions target russia 's finance , oil and defence sectors .
russia criticises the eu for supporting what it calls an illegitimate government in kiev .
author: BBC World Service

documents.title: samsung to build new us plant
text: south korean electronics giant samsung has agreed to open a $ 380m ( £ 294m ) home appliance manufacturing plant in south carolina .
the announcement comes amid fears that president trump 's protectionist policies are putting pressure on global companies to create jobs in the us .
in its statement samsung said the new plant in newberry county , south carolina , should create 954 local jobs by 2020 .
in february , when news of a potential plant , making the likes of washing machines , first emerged , trump tweeted : `` thank you , @ twitterid we would love to have you ! ''

documents.title: wall street on track for winning day
text: less than two hours ahead of the close the dow jones industrial average and s & p 500 are on track for their best one-day percentage gain in about two months , boosted by shares in financial firms .
the dow is at 21,469.07 , a rise of 158 points or 0.74 % , while the s & p is at 2,441.62 , that 's up 22 points or 0.92 % .
the nasdaq is up 1.23 % or 76 points at 6,222.52 tech stocks make a come back .

documents.title: a shop by any other name ? wimbledon business improvement district ( bid ) tweets
text: over the last couple of days we 've brought you the story of the tyneside shop which was forced to change its name from singhsbury 's after sainsbury 's threatened to take legal action .
the owner responded by renaming the store morrisinghs ( see post at 7.04am ) .
well , in wimbledon town centre there 's been a bit of name tweaking going on as well .
supermarket chain morrisons has changed the name of its branch to murrisons ahead of the tennis championships which begin next week .
great day with @ twitterid in @ twitterid kicking off # wimbledon mania # tennistown the crowds loved seeing you !
great photo helen !

documents.title: sugar plant cannabis smell investigated
text: a sugar producer is investigating whether its cannabis farm is responsible for a smell which has been baffling norfolk residents for a week .
british sugar began growing a non‐psychoactive variety of cannabis at its wissington plant this year for use in children 's epilepsy medicine .
following its harvest , people began complaining about the smell of `` weed '' , the eastern daily press reported .
the company said it is taking comments `` seriously '' and investigating .
british sugar began cultivating the cannabis - which produces the active medicinal chemical cannabidiol - after phasing out its tomato production at the site .
the company finished harvesting it on friday , a spokeswoman said .
read more here

documents.title: under-screen fingerprint sensor unveiled
text: qualcomm has announced a fingerprint id sensor designed to be fitted underneath smartphone and tablet screens .
it said the component could also work with wet fingers or underwater and could be used to measure heart rates .
the development paves the way for android device-makers to be able to achieve sleeker designs .
however , one expert said apple could still beat qualcomm to market with a rival screen-integrated sensor of its own .
fingerprint sensors are used to unlock devices without having to type in a code , to authenticate payments and to provide other identity checks .
read more here

documents.title: what did mark carney mean ? chief economic adviser to economic forecasting group , the ey item club , tweets
text: more analysis now of the bank of england governor 's speech earlier today , as commentators examine what he really meant .
take on # carney & # cunliffe remarks : # boe governor looks to be in wait and see '' mode on interest rates via @ twitterid
in wait until he has an excuse to cut again mode , he is , yesss
how cynical
the truth this is , my young padawan .
well enjoy the evening anyway !

documents.title: loan costs to leapbbc personal finance correspondent tweets
text: ft rightly pointing out that student loan interest rate will be 6.1 % from september .
that 's march rpi ( 3.1 % ) plus 3 % .
up from 4.6 % now

documents.title: sterling holds onto gains
text: let 's check in on the pound - and it 's still ahead following those earlier comments by mark carney , which hinted at an interest rate rise if business investment and wages started to improve .
the pound is 1 % ahead against the dollar at $ 1.2943 .
meanwhile , it 's at 1.1379 euros , a rise of 0.66 % .

documents.title: schadenfreude ?
text: german finance minister wolfgang schaeuble has said he hopes the uk will come to realise that it made a mistake with brexit .
`` i hope that the rest of europe will do so well that the british realise at some point that they made a mistake , '' schaeuble said in berlin .
`` whether two years will be sufficient i 'm not sure , '' he added , in reference to the deadline for britain 's exit .

documents.title: ftse 250 ends day lower
text: on the ftse 250 stagecoach fell by 6.2 % after it after it reported a plunge in annual profits .
it said pre-tax profit fell from £ 104.4m to £ 17.9m .
however , the biggest fall on the index was posted by petra diamonds - down by 8.73 % after it warned that its full-year production will be between 8-9 % below its forecast of 4.4 million carats .
the ftse 250 ended the day 0.26 % or 50.45 points lower at 19,476.35 .

documents.title: companies in the news
text: let 's see how shares in some of the companies in today 's news have performed .
tesco finished 1.6 % higher after it announced it was cutting 1,200 jobs at its head office in hertfordshire .
the company says it has to reduce costs in the face of tough market conditions .
following confirmation by city watchdog the financial conduct authority that investors must be quoted an `` all-in fee '' to make charges more transparent , shares in investment firms have dropped .
hargreaves lansdown fell by 2.3 % , property investment and development company segro was down 2.08 % and scottish mortgage investment trust was down by 2.03 % .

documents.title: ftse falls as sterling rises
text: in london the ftse 100 share index closed down on wednesday , as the pound jumped .
it 's dominated by export-led companies which benefit from a low pound .
the ftse 100 finished at 7,387.80 , that 's a fall of 46.56 points or 0.63 % .

documents.title: blue apron slashes launch expectations
text: the biggest meal-kit company in the us , blue apron , has cut the valuation expectations for its stock market launch by a third to $ 11 ( £ 8.50 ) per share , as amazon 's £ 10.5bn deal to buy whole foods market put pressure on prospects for the meal-kit industry .
potential investors are worried about the impact of amazon 's whole foods deal , but also about blue apron 's costly marketing strategy and lack of profitability , sources told reuters .
`` amazon 's deal for whole foods earlier this month added to concerns , but blue apron 's high marketing costs were a negative factor .
snap inc 's ipo earlier this year has shown investors that growth at all costs is a mistake , '' said kathleen smith , principal of renaissance capital .
blue apron delivers packages of ingredients for easy-to-cook meals .
it was founded by matt salzberg (

documents.title: french bank and supermarket targeted by cyber attack
text: france 's biggest bank , bnp paribas , and the french supermarket chain auchan are among the latest victims of tuesday 's cyber attack that has been spreading around the world , reports bbc world service .
some businesses in asia , including india 's largest container port , have also reported disruption .
experts say the attack seems to have been aimed mainly at businesses in ukraine , and the effects spread globally from there .
the hackers sent a message to victims saying their computers would remain frozen until a $ 300 ransom was paid .
but security researchers say the attack was probably aimed at causing disruption rather than seeking financial gain .
technicians say they 've developed a means to fix individual computers , but are still working on how to stop the crippling ransomware from spreading .
author: BBC World Service

documents.title: cyber attacks 'more sophisticated '
text: a wave of cyberattacks hitting europe and north america are similar to last month 's wannacry ransomware havoc , but appear potentially `` more sophisticated '' , europol said .

describing it as `` another serious ransomware attack '' , the european police agency 's director , rob wainwright , said there were `` clear similarities with the wannacry attack but also indications of a more sophisticated attack capability intended to exploit a range of vulnerabilities '' .

documents.title: air india to be privatised
text: india 's cabinet has approved plans to privatise indebted national flag carrier air india , which has been struggling in the face of growing competition from low-cost rivals .
air india was bailed out in 2012 with about £ 4.5bn of federal funds .

documents.title: muddying the waters ?
text: more comment on mark carney 's speech in portugal which indicated that interest rates could rise if business investment grows .
the is now pretty muddy .
only last week mr carney said 'now is not the time ' to tighten .
deputy governor john cunliffe said only today that there is no rush to raise rates .
so we are left guessing - the mpc does not seem to know where it 's at and the debate is taking place in public .
this ought to play out in more vote splits over the summer before a move to 'correct ' its policy mis-step perhaps by the autumn , assuming economic growth and wage growth holds .

documents.title: 'clearest signal yet ' of rate hike
text: mr carney said he would back a rate hike if business investment and wages started to improve .

coming off the back of the 5-3 split at the last ( monetary policy committee ) meeting and hawkish comments from the bank 's chief economist , andy haldane , it 's the clearest signal yet that the bank is minded to tighten .

there is a sense the monetary policy committee may wish to 'correct ' its rate cut last summer in light of a surprisingly resilient uk economy and rising inflation , which is accelerating quicker than the bank expected .

documents.title: forex markets ignore carney 'nuances '
text: some comment now on the jump in sterling which was prompted by bank of england governor mark carney 's speech .
a caveat-laden statement from mark carney caused a super-surge from sterling this wednesday .

investors were uninterested in the nuances of what carney was actually saying , focusing on the fact that the boe chief said 'some removal of monetary stimulus is likely to become necessary ' but ignoring that the central banker made it clear a lot of things , like uk wage growth and business investment ( not to mention brexit ) , need to move in the right direction for that to happen .

documents.title: pound leaps on carney comments
text: the pound has jumped by more than 1 % against the dollar to $ 1.2946 following comments by bank of england governor mark carney hinting that interest rates could rise if stronger business investment boosts the uk economy .

speaking at the european central bank forum on central banking in portugal mr carney said `` some removal of monetary stimulus is likely to become necessary '' , but would depend on whether an increase in business spending could counter the slowdown in consumer consumption triggered by rising inflation .
the comments are more hawkish than mr carney 's mansion house speech last week when he said `` now is not yet the time to begin that adjustment '' .

documents.title: eu needs to 'spend less or find new money ' post brexit
text: the eu 's budget commissioner guenther oettinger has warned that the bloc must either spend less or find new money from somewhere to cope with the loss of about £ 9bn a year when the uk leaves .
that 's 16 % of the entire eu budget .
presenting the fifth and final discussion paper on the eu 's future , mr oettinger said each euro spent must have a positive impact on people 's lives .
the bbc 's europe reporter says the disappearance of britain 's annual rebate will make the budget process simpler .
author: BBC World Service

documents.title: wall street ahead at start of trade
text: all three key us share indexes opened higher on wednesday .
the dow jones is at 21,408.83 , that 's a rise of 98 points or 0.46 % .
the s & p 500 is at 2,429.27 , up 10 points or 0.41 % .
and the tech-heavy nasdaq is at 6,150.54 , that 's up 4 points or 0.06 % .

documents.title: switzerland to tighten capital requirements for smaller banks
text: the swiss federal government plans to tighten capital rules for the country 's three most important domestic lenders to ensure taxpayers do n't have to bail them out in the event of a financial crisis .

it 's proposing to extend `` gone concern '' rules - that is capital needed to insure against the costs of bank failure - beyond big banks ubs and credit suisse to include primarily domestic lenders postfinance ag , raiffeisen and zuercher kantonalbank .
`` like for the big banks , they should reflect the going concern capital requirements , but only 40 % of them .

with this proposal , the ( federal government ) is taking into consideration the fact that the banks in question are less interconnected internationally and are thus less systemically important , '' it said in a statement .
the government has instructed the finance ministry to work with the finma watchdog and the swiss national bank ( snb ) on a draft of the proposals .

documents.title: euro down against pound
text: and as this graph shows the euro has had a bit of an up and down day against the pound .
it 's currently down 0.18 % at 88.31 pence .

documents.title: euro loses ground
text: here 's what the euro has been doing against the dollar so far today - after hitting 12-month highs it 's now edged down slightly to $ 1.1336 .

documents.title: can the minimum wage rise too fast ?
text: it 's generally thought that increases in the minimum wage have little impact on employment .
the uk is a good example , where the minimum wage has been rising in recent years , yet unemployment remains low .
however economists interested in this area have been keeping a close eye on seattle .
the us city made sharp increases in the minimum wage in 2015 and 2016 and recent research has shown that it may have cost low-wage workers .
you can read more here .

documents.title: draghi comments misinterpreted ?
text: the euro fell and government bond yields across the eurozone fell back from earlier gains on wednesday after central bank sources told press agency reuters that the market had over-analysed earlier comments from mario draghi .
sources told the media organisation that ecb chief draghi had intended to signal tolerance for a period of weaker inflation , not an imminent policy tightening .
the ecb declined to comment .

documents.title: comparing public and private sector pay
text: conservative mp sir oliver letwin has been on radio 4 talking about when the freeze on public sector pay rises may be relaxed .

`` sooner or later there will need to be some movement on the rate of increase of public sector pay because we 're getting close to the point at which the huge increase in public sector pay compared to private sector pay which we inherited in 2010 is leveling out , '' he said .
you can see what he 's talking about in the chart above - around 2010 , average earnings in the public sector were growing at about 4 % while in the private sector it was barely moving .
that situation has clearly reversed since mid-2013 .
but there are caveats when comparing public and private sector pay .
for example , many public sector bodies have outsourced lower-paid functions such as cleaning and catering to contractors , which moves them from the public to the private sector .
doing so on a large scale would increase average earnings in the public sector .
the institute for fiscal studies has warned that the quality of public services will suffer if public sector pay continues to fall compared with the private sector .
author: Reality Check

documents.title: listen : qatar may face more sanctions
text: gulf states rachet up pressure on qatar - plus the elderly lady who threw coins into an aeroplane 's engine for luck .
author: BBC World Service

documents.title: pay more , get less ?
text: are you shocked at the charges which some fund managers are skimming off your savings ?
if you look at what the financial watchdog has sniffed out , you probably should be .
the total levied amounts to 1.5 % a year on a ty share-based investment fund , in which the manager the shares .
it can be confusing .
there is a headline charge , then often other fees on top .
what are you getting for that ?
after all , you could be in a tracker fund which automatically follows a share index , charging just 0.2 % .
the financial conduct authority found that on average , the cheapest funds generated higher returns than the most expensive ones .
of course , an individual whizzkid manager might achieve stellar returns .
but , ty the more you pay , the less you seem to get .
full story here .
author: Simon Gompertz
BBC personal finance correspondent

documents.title: cyber-attack hits europe 's biggest container port
text: one of europe 's biggest container terminals has resorted to using gmail and what'sapp to keep its operations going today .
that 's after the cyber-attack that has hit companies all over the world took down its computer systems .
apm terminals , which is part of danish shipping giant maersk , has been operating without internet and phone links .
`` all our people are in place , and the terminal is open , '' apm spokesman tom boyd told the news agency afp .
`` today we are handling 4,500 containers .
it 's more labour extensive , but we are making it work .
we are communicating with our customers through gmail and other things because the it system is down . ''
rotterdam is europe 's biggest port and one of the biggest in the world .

documents.title: michael bond dies
text: michael bond , the creator of paddington bear , died at home aged 91 on tuesday following a short illness , his publisher harpercollins said .

documents.title: brazil stops issuing passports
text: brazil has announced it will temporarily stop issuing passports due to the lack of financial resources .
the federal police usually issue passports within six working days , but the institution said there is no plan for new requests to be met .
brazil is approaching winter holiday season - one of the year 's peak times for travel .
a police officer 's union has criticised the government of embattled president michel temer for not allocating enough resources to homeland security and border control .
sectors of the federal police are also at loggerheads with the government , as the institution is responsible for investigating high-level corruption .
brazil is still facing the effects of the worst recession in decades , and the government has been implementing budget cuts which affect services to the population .
author: Daniel Gallas
BBC South America business correspondent

documents.title: tesco cuts : 'rules of game have changed '
text: steve dresser is an independent retail analyst .
he has been tweeting his reaction to the the 1,200 job cuts at tesco headquarters .
above all else , sad for folk who lose their roles .
but it 's another reminder of how the rules of the game have changed .
not wholly - executive pay still not reflecting the new world
expect a good exec is arguably worth even more in the new world .
it 's not communist russia .
maybe a kleptocracy ?
just look at payoffs for failed execs .
back to usual question though - who will buy things when there are no jobs ?
there was advocacy for £ 10 minimum wage at election time .
now there 'll be no jobs .
there 's plenty of margin within the whole supply chain .
other countries have living wages and jobs .
yes .
perhaps we should move there .
need to brush up on my swedish ; - )
correct , the business is not about customers anymore , more about how to keep the share price up and keep the investors on board .
that 's not new - and not only in retail !
you do wonder how much longer city-driven business model can be sustained much longer
the retail market is continually changing , kinda naive if we thought changes would n't happened to reflect them .
personally i ca n't see this being the end of cuts sure there will be more around soon !
the rules have n't changed , just the moral 's of the guys in charge .

ours is coming soon
we knew drastic would be just that , it makes sense at a high level as central costs were out of control post the clarke era .

documents.title: co-op bank rescue : context from simon jack
text: the co-op bank has been limping along for four years since an abortive attempt to buy 632 branches from lloyds revealed a £ 1.5 billion hole in its finances .

after failing to find a buyer for the bank - the existing owners , which are predominantly us investment funds , have agreed to write off £ 443 million pounds they are owed and will sell 250 million pounds worth of new shares .

the bank , well known for its ethical approach has been under intense supervision from the bank of england for many months and today 's injection of fresh money will spare the regulator the job of stepping in to manage a wind up of the bank .
the investors will also pump £ 100m into the bank 's pension scheme over the next ten years to secure its separation from the wider co-op group pension scheme .

despite its troubles , co-op bank 's customers have proved very loyal with nearly 4 million account holders and mortgage borrowers sticking with the bank despite its financial difficuties and a sex and drug scandal involving its former chairman , methodist minister paul flowers .
the bank says it will continue to run itself with the ethical values it has observed since its founding in 1872 .
author: Simon Jack
BBC Business Editor

documents.title: co-op group holding to fall to just 1 %
text: the co-operative group will end up owning just 1 % of co-operative bank after the rescue deal has gone through .
at the moment it has a 20 % stake .
as a result co-op group will stop marketing co-op bank services to its members in 2020 .

documents.title: breakingco-op bank rescue plan agreed
text: a rescue plan for co-operative bank has been agreed .
the hedge fund investors who own the bank 's debt will contribute another £ 443m to the bank and will also help it raise another £ 250m in fresh funding .

documents.title: tesco job cuts
text: tesco will cut 1,200 jobs at its head office , the press association reports .
more details as we get them .

documents.title: only in the ft
text: we all know financial times readers are a thoughtful lot , and if you do n't believe us here 's proof from the pink 'un 's editor , lionel barber .
letter of the day , only @ twitterid on the important difference between bullshit and nonsense
speaking of b.s .
etc. , this from a while back was good on trump & the truth :

documents.title: stagecoach shares plunge
text: stagecoach shares have plunged more than 10 % , making them the biggest loser on the ftse 250 index .
the company , which is headquartered in perth scotland , is probably best known for its bus services in the uk and north america .
it also owns a 49 % stake in the virgin rail group and runs other train franchises .
earlier it reported a 15 % fall in full-year profit to £ 84m .

the company 's chief executive said that sales on the east coast rail line franchise , part of its virgin rail group , had not met expectations and it did not expect the service to be profitable until 2019 .

documents.title: tax junk food - tebbit
text: assistant political editor norman smith tweets :

this idea would affect the poor the most .

documents.title: greece 'must step up privatisation '
text: is now the time that greece will finally accelerate its privatisation programme ?
the indebted nation has been promising to sell off the family silver since the eurozone crisis began some eight years ago .
it has only raised 3.4bn euros so far .

now its deputy finance minister , george chouliarakis says : `` a lot more needs to be done there , especially improving the business environment be more assertive in advancing for direct investments , in accelerating the base of the privatisation programme , ''
up for sale are stakes in greece 's natural gas grid desfa and the second biggest port , located in thessaloniki .

documents.title: oil falls on rising us stockpiles
text: oil prices headed downwards on wednesday after data revealed that us stocks of crude had grown .
brent crude fell by 0.4 % to $ 46.46 a barrel .
west texas intermediate is off 0.5 % at $ 44.02 a barrel .
the american petroleum institute said on tuesday us crude inventories rose by 851,000 barrels .
analysts had expected a decline .

documents.title: breakingfour arrests over scam phone calls
text: four arrests have been made as part of an investigation into computer software service fraud , which is thought to cost hundreds of millions of pounds worldwide .
a collaboration between the city of london police and microsoft , the investigation has been looking into the tens of thousands of reports of software service fraud made each year .
it often involves the victim being contacted and told there is a problem with their computer and that the issue can be resolved - for a fee .
but no fix occurs and once the fraudster has access to the victim 's computer they can install potentially malicious software .
a 29-year-old man and a 31-year-old woman , from woking , surrey , were arrested on sus of fraud and both have been bailed .
a 37-year-old man and 35-year-old woman were arrested in south shields , tyneside , on sus of fraud and were later released pending further enquiries .

documents.title: mr meow-meow and his magical hand
text: this australian can now tap in and out at train stations with a travel card chip implanted in his left hand .
meow-ludo disco gamma meow-meow ( yes , that 's his legal name ) says he had it put under his skin by a professional piercer .
meow-ludo says his new implant gives him `` an ability not everyone else has '' .
read the full story here .

documents.title: petra 's forecast loses sparkle
text: petra diamonds ' share price is down by 6.61 % at 105.9p after the miner warned that its full-year production will be between 8-9 % below its forecast of 4.4 million carats .
petra owns the cullinan mine that has produced the two largest diamonds in the british crown jewels which were not shown off this year following a dressed down queen 's speech .
petra said annual sales are also likely to fall between 8-9 % .

documents.title: bank of england 's cunliffe : not the time for a rate rise
text: wrong time for interest rate rise , cunliffe warns
the terrorist bank of england should 've increased interest rates about seven years ago , but that would n't help their city mates + hm gov .
@ twitterid been suggesting interest rates should have gradually been increased by 0.25 % every 3-6 mths last 4 years .
dim economists
personal debt is mounting because there is no incentive to save and fuelling spiralling house price increases
no it is n't interest rates have been artificially held at a ridiculously low rate for far too long , encouraging overspending on credit
another financial nob !

documents.title: upbeat dixons carphone bucks trend
text: dixons carphone 's strong full-year results have provided a much-needed boost for the uk 's retail sector .

george salmon , equity analyst at hargreaves lansdown , says : given june has so far brought a damaging profit warning from dfs and some pretty gloomy retail figures from the ons , it 's reassuring to hear dixons say that for now at least , the uk consumer environment seems to be holding up . ''
he says the company has its strengths , `` not least its unique position as the last electrical specialist standing on the uk high street '' .
but he adds : `` the company faces the triple threat of amazon 's relentless expansion , sterling 's weakness and a squeezed uk consumer . ''

documents.title: lights out
text: edinburgh airport has been plunged into darkness after a power cut .
scotland 's busiest airport tweeted : `` we 're currently experiencing a power outage .
the safety and security of our passengers is priority , please work with us as we fix the issue . ''

documents.title: euro pushes higher
text: bad news for british holidaymakers .
the pound has slipped to its lowest level since last november against the euro .
a short whole ago it was trading at a third of euro cent lower at 1.1268 euros .
the euro is also looking strong against the dollar trading 0.3 % higher at $ 1.1377 .
the euro surged on tuesday after comments from the chief of the european central bank mario draghi .
traders think the ecb might be moving towards trimming stimulus programme this year .

`` i do think the euro now has got quite significant momentum behind it and i think that will build towards the confirmation of some tapering announcement this year , '' said david stubb , from jp morgan asset management .

documents.title: breakingbnp paribas hit by global cyber-attack
text: french banking giant bnp paribas is the latest big company to be hit by the latest global cyber-attack .
it says its property business has been hit by the attack .

documents.title: letwin : tax rises might be necessary
text: it 's not often you hear a senior conservative mp agreeing that taxes will probably have to head higher .
conservative mp sir oliver letwin has said taxes could increase for a large number of people in order to reduce the deficit and increase spending on public services .

documents.title: co-op bank rescue expected soon
text: business editor , simon jack tweets :
co-op bank rescue expected this am .
co-op group will own a tiny fraction .
us hedge funds majority .
long way from quaker roots in 1872 .
think it could be time to look for a new bank

documents.title: maersk hit by cyber-attack , but ships are safe
text: danish shipping giant maersk has been hit by global cyber-attack .
it has been forced to shut down a number of computer systems to contain the problem .
however , the company said : `` maersk line vessels are maneuverable , able to communicate and crews are safe . ''

documents.title: the real question for the uk economy
text: the `` sensible '' thing for the bank of england to do would be to , very slowly , begin raising interest rates , said deanne julius , former member of the monetary policy committee and chair of university college london .
economics editor kamal ahmed points out that the big problem facing the economy is falling real wages .
`` how do we create wealth , how do we make people feel better off , '' is the real question according to kamal .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: uk regulator targets fund managers
text: with a 2.5 % fall , shares in hargreaves lansdown are the biggest losers on the ftse 100 so far this morning .
the fall follows news from uk regulators that they are going to investigate investment platforms , like that of hargreaves .
it is part of a broader package of measures to raise competition in the industry .
today programme business presenter , dominic o'connell tweets :
also from @ twitterid report - fund managers make a 35 % profit margin ( ! )
explains all those porsches going in and out of city and canary wharf
those are the traders not the fund managers .
hedge fund managers tend to be based in mayfair and they drive ferraris .

be great to see funds opened up across uk to share the inherited wealth .
jobs for the boys .
# city # hedge # shares
and do n't we know it !
pension management fees increasing by av.3 % each yr when incomes have increased by 1 %
in @ twitterid report - a further investigation planned into investment platforms like @ twitterid

documents.title: the right medicine ?
text: north america technology reporter dave lee has been taking a closer look at the cyber attack that hit on tuesday .
more on that `` vaccine '' for yesterday 's cyber-attack .
seems clear this had very little to do with money

why this guys hair look like he 's lieing ?

documents.title: ftse 100 kick-off lower
text: the ftse 100 has opened with losses , it 's down 0.3 % at 7,410 .
as for individual movers in london : stagecoach is down more than 2 % after its trading update .
dixons carphone is up more than 1 % after its full-year results .
the pound is steady against the dollar at $ 1.2801 .
the euro is holding on to tuesday 's gains against the dollar , trading at $ 1.1354 .

documents.title: uk house prices rebound - nationwide report
text: the latest housing market data is out from nationwide .
not many homes for sale so prices rise despite `` emerging squeeze on household incomes '' says nationwide
house price crash has already happened .
but there is no market so hard to see .

documents.title: regulator addresses concerns over fund management
text: the financial conduct authority has announced a package of measures to increase competition and value for money in the fund management business .
among the measures , funds should disclose a single , all-in fee to investors .
barriers to pension scheme consolidation will also be removed .
the fca also wants to strengthen the duty on fund managers to act in the best interest of investors .

documents.title: how would you pay for higher government spending ?
text: how could higher government spending by paid for ?
`` the chancellor does have a bit of space to increase borrowing , '' says paul johnson .
alternatively you could raise tax .
`` you have to do something that hits everybody , which puts a penny on all the rates on income tax or vat you ca n't make a big difference just from [ taxing ] the rich , '' mr johnson said .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: labour calls for vote on more public spending
text: labour have forced a vote calling for more public spending , including the removal of the 1 % cap on public sector pay increases .
as the bill for public sector pay is about £ 180bn per year , that will cost £ 1.8bn for every 1 % increase , points out paul johnson , director of the institute for fiscal studies .

`` at some point the government will have to lift that cap , because we are getting to the point where pay in the public sector is beginning to fall behind pay in the private sector relative to where it was before the crisis , but it is only just beginning to do that . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: dixon carphone reports solid results
text: dixons carphone has reported a 4 % rise in like-for-like sales for the year to 29 april .
pre-tax profit was up 10 % at £ 501m .
the company said that the market appears to be `` holding-up '' for them .

documents.title: from singhsbury 's to morrisinghs
text: a shop in tyneside , which was forced to change its name from singhsbury 's after sainsbury 's threatened to take legal action , has been re-launched with a new name .
it 's now called morrisinghs , and morrisons is apparently quite relaxed about the name .
`` i 've took the risk , but i 've been very careful , '' says the owner of morrisinghs , jel singh nagra .
`` the colour scheme is different , '' he says .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: 'we are clearly starting to tire of austerity '
text: some 48 % of brits want higher taxation to support increased spending , according to this year 's british social attitudes survey .
that 's the highest level since the 2008 financial crisis , when only a third of respondents wanted higher taxation and spending .
`` we are clearly starting to tire of austerity , '' he says .
however , we should not get too carried away with that figure .
`` for much of the 1990s it was an awful lot higher and even into the early noughties , '' said roger harding , head of public attitudes at the national centre for social research .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: philips share buyback and acquisition
text: electronics giant , philips has announced a share buyback scheme worth 1.5bn euros .
the scheme starts later this year and will run for two years .
the company also announced the purchase of medical technology firm , spectranetics in a deal worth 1.9bn euros .

documents.title: analysts see lower start for european stocks
text: stocks set to open lower as oil jitters continue | cmc markets

documents.title: chocolate meltdown : asia firms hit by ransomware attack
text: asian business have been reporting that they have fallen victim to the major global ransomware cyber-attack which swept through europe and the us on tuesday .
a cadbury factory in tasmania - which makes about 50,000 tonnes of chocolate a year , mainly for the australian market - has halted production according to union officials .
cadbury 's parent company , the food giant mondelez , is one of the international firms that reported problems on tuesday .
meanwhile operations at one of the three terminals of india 's largest container port , jawaharlal nehru port trust in mumbai came to a standstill as its software systems shut down .
the port is run by danish shipping giant ap moller-maersk which is also suffering issues at other operations around the world .
author: Simon Atkinson
Asia Business Reporter

documents.title: has the bank of england encouraged borrowing ?
text: has the bank of england spurred borrowing by keeping interest rates so low for such a long time ?

when it comes to unsecured lending , like credit cards and car loans `` banks underwriting standards should be constant and they 're not affected by what the bank of england does on interest rates , '' says sir jon cunliffe , deputy governor of the bank of england .
`` the average interest rate on personal loans is about 7-8 % .
the bank of england bank rate is just a very , very small fraction of that . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: toshiba fails to clinch memory chip deal
text: toshiba shares have fallen on wednesday after the firm said it had failed to complete the sale of its lucrative memory chip business .
it had hoped to seal a deal with a consortium of us , south korean and state-backed japanese investors , reportedly worth about $ 18bn ( £ 14.1bn ) .
it ; s not clear what the delay is , but there has been strong opposition .
on tuesday , western digital resubmitted its bid for the flash memory unit .
toshiba desperately needs the cash as it tries to plug the hole in its finances after massive losses at its us nuclear operations .
author: Simon Atkinson
Asia Business Reporter

documents.title: good morning !
text: the saga over toshiba has taken another turn this morning , as it fails to sell its computer chip business .
a rescue deal for co-op bank could be announced later .
we 'll hear from one of the most senior figures at the bank of england , sir jon cunliffe .
plus full-year results are due from dixons carphone later .
author: Ben Morris
Business reporter
